results.title: Risk and forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Shows how an analysis of all sources of industrial risks must be taken into account to ensure that enterprise is successful and long-living.

results.title: Production control. Part I
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The systematic procedure by which management regulates production to meet fluctuating demand consists of four main steps; routing, scheduling, despatching, and follow-up. This film develops the firs step, fully showing the basic importance of routing in manufacture.

results.title: Product development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The film considered the following: (1) The role of research in improving materials processes and product; (2) the qualifications for acceptable product ideas such as production requirements in relation to existing facilities; (3) and aspects of product engineering.

results.title: Physical facilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Describes the steps in organising physical facilities of a new enterprise: 1) location from the aspect of available facilities; 2) type of building suited to the enterprise; 3) the arrangement and position of the buildings; 4) plant layout from the aspect of type production.

results.title: Methods analysis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Methods analysis is used to reduce production costs by increasing the productivity of men and machines. The film demonstrates the basic approach and techniques of the methods analyst in studying the manufacturing cycle and indicates methods for gaining employee co-operation.

results.title: Master weavers of the Andes
results.brief_description: Examines the craft of weaving as practised by the Quechua Indians near Cuzco, Peru. Points out that except for the use of chemical dyes, the processes of spinning and weaving are practised as they have been for centuries. Camera and editing Peter Pilafian. Narrated by David Ossman.

results.title: Mass transit: up, up and away
results.brief_description: Argues that the car is a real hazard in urban societies, as well as being a cause of pollution. Examines various alternative means of mass transportation.

results.title: Mass radiography
results.creator_credit: S.O. Siecki, H.M. Nieter and Seven League Unit
results.brief_description: By means of mobile X-Ray units it is possible to take radiograms of large numbers of people I a relatively short time. These photographs are then examined by expert radiologists, and diagnoses made. In this film, the visit of a mobile X-Ray unit to a British factory is shown. (The film is intended for use by Medical Officers and Health and Welfare Officers when they are planning to send a mobile X-Ray unit to a place not previously visited). Also made for the prevention of tuberculosis. Narrated by Lionel Gamlin.

results.title: Marloo the Red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Looks at the life history of the red kangaroo. Shows details of the birth and care of the young, and includes information on typical adult kangaroos in their natural state, in various parts of Australia. Also discusses the problem of conservation.
results.description: Looks at the life history of the red kangaroo. Shows details of the birth and care of the young, and includes information on typical adult kangaroos in their natural state, in various parts of Australia. Also discusses the problem of conservation.
